results.title: Countering China’s Space Silk Road: a U.S. partnership model for the Middle East
results.summary:

results.title: NASA Patent Remix Challenge
results.summary: NASA’s Technology Transfer Office invites entrepreneurs, innovators, and creative thinkers to apply NASA’s patented technologies to practical applications. Participants will select an existing NASA patent and develop a business or product concept that will be evaluated based on value proposition, business model viability, development feasibility, and quality of presentation. Entries should clearly demonstrate creativity, feasibility, […]

results.title: Live coverage: ULA to launch ViaSat-3 following valve replacement on Atlas 5 rocket
results.summary: The mission is the second of three planned spacecraft that Viasat plans to operate in geostationary orbit. United Launch Alliance is targeting liftoff from pad 41 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station at 10:04 p.m. EST (0304 UTC).

results.title: Keeping America first in space
results.summary:
In this episode of Space Minds, host David Ariosto speaks with Jim Bridenstine, former NASA Administrator and U.S. Congressman, who oversaw the launch of the Artemis program—America’s renewed effort to return astronauts to the Moon.
The post Keeping America first in space appeared first on SpaceNews.

results.title: Live coverage: Blue Origin to launch NASA’s ESCAPADE following scrubs from clouds, space weather
results.summary: Blue Origin was able to secure permission from the Federal Aviation Administration for a daytime launch attempt while the emergency order constraining commercial launches remains in place even after the end of the government shutdown. Liftoff is scheduled during an 88-minute-long window that opens at 2:57 p.m. EST (1957 UTC).

results.title: Spectrum Rocket Stages Arrive at Launch Facility for Second Flight
results.summary:
German launch services provider Isar Aerospace has announced that the stages for the second flight of its Spectrum rocket have arrived at its launch facility in Norway. Isar Aerospace launched the inaugural flight of its 28-metre, two-stage Spectrum rocket on 30 March. Less than thirty seconds after liftoff, the rocket’s Flight Termination System was triggered […]
The post Spectrum Rocket Stages Arrive at Launch Facility for Second Flight appeared first on European Spaceflight.

results.title:
A close-up look
at the first metal
part made in space
results.summary: This February, the first-ever metal part 3D-printed in space landed on Earth. Produced in the European Space Agency’s Metal 3D Printer Technology Demonstrator on the International Space Station, it is now in the hands of ESA’s engineers at ESTEC, the agency’s technical centre in the Netherlands, who poke and prod it to understand how microgravity affected its printing process.
